data.text: This is a prayer of Habakkuk the prophet, according to Shigionoth:3:1 Shigionoth is probably a musical term indicating the setting for the prayer.
O LORD, I have heard the report of You;
His radiance was like the sunlight;
He stood and measured the earth;
I saw the tents of Cushan in distress;
Were You angry at the rivers, O LORD?
The mountains saw You and quaked;
You marched across the earth with fury;
You went forth for the salvation of Your people,
With his own spear You pierced his head,
You trampled the sea with Your horses,
Though the fig tree does not bud
yet I will exult in the LORD;
GOD the Lord is my strength;
